sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Edinburgh, the seventh day of December, one thousand six hundred and sixty five Charles, by the grace of God, King of Great Britain, France and Ireland, defender of the faith ... our sheriffs in that part conjunctly and severally, specially constitute, greeting : forsameikle as the assembling and conveening our subjects, without our warrand and authority, is a most dangerous and unlawful practise ... Scotland. Privy Council. Scotland. Sovereign (1649-1685 : Charles II).
1 sheet ([1] p.).
Printed by Evan Tyler, [Edinburgh : 1665]
Title from caption and first lines of text. Publication data suggested by Wing (2nd ed.). Imperfect: lacks second page. Royal arms at head of text, initial letter. Text in black letter. Reproduction of original in: National Library of Scotland.
=======
Edinburgh, the seventh day of December, one thousand six hundred and sixty five Charles, by the grace of God, King of Great Britain, France and Ireland, defender of the faith ... our sheriffs in that part conjunctly and severally, specially constitute, greeting : forsameikle as the assembling and conveening our subjects, without our warrand and authority, is a most dangerous and unlawful practise ... Scotland. Privy Council. Scotland. Sovereign (1649-1685 : Charles II).
1 sheet ([1] p.).
Printed by Evan Tyler, [Edinburgh : 1665]
Title from caption and first lines of text. Publication data suggested by Wing (2nd ed.). Imperfect: lacks second page. Royal arms at head of text, initial letter. Text in black letter. Reproduction of original in: National Library of Scotland.
